title: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain risks wrath of Little Mix girlfriend Perrie Edwards with new Call of Duty game
text:

Liverpool star Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain could have problems with Little Mix girlfriend Perrie Edwards after trialling Three's new Call of Duty 5G.

The pop singer joked in the past that she had fallen out with the England international, who she has dated since 2016, due to his love of the video game.

But after becoming the first person to trial the latest instalment of the gaming phenomenon Call of Duty Modern Warfare, which is released on October 25, Chamberlain now wants to install the hyper-immersive gameplay at home.

Speaking about the game, Jasmine Skee, director of propositions at Three, said: "This is a fantastic experience to bring to life the power and speeds of our 5G network.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

"The Call of Duty 5G experience is unimaginably good, creating a seamless, in the moment immersive environment which takes something familiar like gaming in your lounge and amps it up to a whole new level."

"And it’s not just gaming that is being taken to the next level through 5G. We see 5G at the heart of future home entertainment – from feeling like you’re pitch-side at a football match, to being in the front row at a festival, or in the middle of your favourite action movie – the versatility of 5G to power your connected home, means the possibilities are endless."

The multi-sensory experience will be open to the public for free at Studio Three's flagship Oxford Street store in London between October 26-30.

(Image: REUTERS)

Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp will be hoping Chamberlain is not too distracted by the game as he looks to break back into the starting 11.

The 26-year-old scored Liverpool's opener in their Champions League clash with Genk on Wednesday night.
description: The Liverpool forward was the first person to trial Three's new hyper-immersive experience
